methodology: Hand-curated from 962 actual World Bank comparative indicators

best_50_indicators.name: Birth rate, crude (per 1,000 people)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Crude birth rate indicates the number of live births occurring during the year, per 1,000 population estimated at midyear. Subtracting the crude death rate from the crude birth rate provides the rate
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: birth rate?

best_50_indicators.name: Death rate, crude (per 1,000 people)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Crude death rate indicates the number of deaths occurring during the year, per 1,000 population estimated at midyear. Subtracting the crude death rate from the crude birth rate provides the rate of na
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: death rate?

best_50_indicators.name: Fertility rate, total (births per woman)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Total fertility rate represents the number of children that would be born to a woman if she were to live to the end of her childbearing years and bear children in accordance with age-specific fertilit
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: fertility rate?

best_50_indicators.name: Life expectancy at birth, total (years)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Life expectancy at birth indicates the number of years a newborn infant would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country has the highest life expectancy?

best_50_indicators.name: Population ages 0-14 (% of total population)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Population between the ages 0 to 14 as a percentage of the total population. Population is based on the de facto definition of population.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: population ages 0-14?

best_50_indicators.name: Population ages 15-64 (% of total population)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Total population between the ages 15 to 64 as a percentage of the total population. Population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: population ages 15-64?

best_50_indicators.name: Population ages 65 and above (% of total population)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Population ages 65 and above as a percentage of the total population. Population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: population ages 65 and above?

best_50_indicators.name: Population, total
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Total population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship. The values shown are midyear estimates.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country has the most people?

best_50_indicators.name: Rural population (% of total population)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Rural population refers to people living in rural areas as defined by national statistical offices. It is calculated as the difference between total population and urban population.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: rural population?

best_50_indicators.name: Urban population (% of total population)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Urban population refers to people living in urban areas as defined by national statistical offices. The data are collected and smoothed by United Nations Population Division.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: urban population?

best_50_indicators.name: GDP (current US$)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Gross domestic product is the total income earned through the production of goods and services in an economic territory during an accounting period. It can be measured in three different ways: using e
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: gdp (current us$)?

best_50_indicators.name: GDP growth (annual %)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Gross domestic product is the total income earned through the production of goods and services in an economic territory during an accounting period. It can be measured in three different ways: using e
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: gdp growth?

best_50_indicators.name: GDP per capita (current US$)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Gross domestic product is the total income earned through the production of goods and services in an economic territory during an accounting period. It can be measured in three different ways: using e
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country has the highest GDP per person?

best_50_indicators.name: GNI per capita, Atlas method (current US$)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Gross national income is the total income earned by all residents within an economic territory during an accounting period. It is equal to gross domestic product plus earned income receivable from abr
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: gni per capita?

best_50_indicators.name: Inflation, consumer prices (annual %)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Inflation as measured by the consumer price index reflects the annual percentage change in the cost to the average consumer of acquiring a basket of goods and services that may be fixed or changed at
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: inflation?

best_50_indicators.name: Unemployment, total (% of total labor force) (modeled ILO estimate)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Unemployment refers to the share of the labor force that is without work but available for and seeking employment.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country has the highest unemployment rate?

best_50_indicators.name: Literacy rate, adult total (% of people ages 15 and above)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: literacy rate?

best_50_indicators.name: School enrollment, primary (% net)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basi
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: school enrollment, primary?

best_50_indicators.name: School enrollment, primary, female (% net)

best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: school enrollment, primary?

best_50_indicators.name: School enrollment, secondary (% net)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Secondary education completes the provision o
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: school enrollment, secondary?

best_50_indicators.name: School enrollment, secondary, female (% net)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Secondary education completes the provision o
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: school enrollment, secondary?

best_50_indicators.name: School enrollment, secondary, male (% net)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Secondary education completes the provision o
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: school enrollment, secondary?

best_50_indicators.name: School enrollment, tertiary (% gross)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Tertiary education, whether
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country has the highest university enrollment?

best_50_indicators.name: School enrollment, tertiary, female (% gross)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Tertiary education, whether
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country has the highest university enrollment?

best_50_indicators.name: School enrollment, tertiary, male (% gross)

best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country has the highest university enrollment?

best_50_indicators.name: Electricity production from coal sources (% of total)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: The share of electricity production from coal sources of total electricity production. Sources of electricity refer to the inputs used to generate electricity. Coal refers to all coal and brown coal,
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: electricity production from coal sources?

best_50_indicators.name: Electricity production from hydroelectric sources (% of total)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: The share of electricity production from hydroelectric sources of total electricity production. Sources of electricity refer to the inputs used to generate electricity. Hydropower refers to electricit
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: electricity production from hydroelectric sources?

best_50_indicators.name: Electricity production from natural gas sources (% of total)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: The share of electricity production from natural gas sources of total electricity production. Sources of electricity refer to the inputs used to generate electricity. Gas refers to natural gas but exc
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: electricity production from natural gas sources?

best_50_indicators.name: Electricity production from nuclear sources (% of total)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: The share of electricity production from nuclear sources of total electricity production. Sources of electricity refer to the inputs used to generate electricity. Nuclear power refers to electricity p
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: electricity production from nuclear sources?

best_50_indicators.name: Electricity production from oil sources (% of total)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: The share of electricity production from oil sources of total electricity production. Sources of electricity refer to the inputs used to generate electricity. Oil refers to crude oil and petroleum pro
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: electricity production from oil sources?

best_50_indicators.name: Forest area (% of land area)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Forest area (% of land area) is the share of total land area that is under natural or planted stands of trees of at least 5 meters in situ, whether productive or not, and excludes tree stands in agric
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country has the most forest coverage?

best_50_indicators.name: Renewable energy consumption (% of total final energy consumption)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Renewable energy consumption is the share of renewables energy in total final energy consumption.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: renewable energy consumption?

best_50_indicators.name: Current health expenditure (% of GDP)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Level of current health expenditure expressed as a percentage of GDP.  Estimates of current health expenditures include healthcare goods and services consumed during each year. This indicator does not
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country spends the most on healthcare?

best_50_indicators.name: Hospital beds (per 1,000 people)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Hospital beds include inpatient beds available in public, private, general, and specialized hospitals and rehabilitation centers. In most cases beds for both acute and chronic care are included.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: hospital beds?

best_50_indicators.name: Mortality rate, under-5 (per 1,000 live births)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Under-five mortality rate is the probability per 1,000 that a newborn baby will die before reaching age five, if subject to age-specific mortality rates of the specified year.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: mortality rate, under-5?

best_50_indicators.name: Mortality rate, under-5, female (per 1,000 live births)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Under-five mortality rate, female is the probability per 1,000 that a newborn female baby will die before reaching age five, if subject to female age-specific mortality rates of the specified year.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: mortality rate, under-5?

best_50_indicators.name: Mortality rate, under-5, male (per 1,000 live births)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Under-five mortality rate, male is the probability per 1,000 that a newborn male baby will die before reaching age five, if subject to male age-specific mortality rates of the specified year.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: mortality rate, under-5?

best_50_indicators.name: Physicians (per 1,000 people)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Physicians include generalist and specialist medical practitioners.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: physicians?

best_50_indicators.name: Prevalence of overweight, weight for height (% of children under 5)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Prevalence of overweight children is the percentage of children under age 5 whose weight for height is more than two standard deviations above the median for the international reference population of
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: prevalence of overweight?

best_50_indicators.name: Military expenditure (% of GDP)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Military expenditures data from SIPRI are derived from the NATO definition, which includes all current and capital expenditures on the armed forces, including peacekeeping forces; defense ministries a
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country spends the most on military?

best_50_indicators.name: Patent applications, nonresidents
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Patent applications are worldwide patent applications filed through the Patent Cooperation Treaty procedure or with a national patent office for exclusive rights for an invention--a product or process
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: patent applications, nonresidents?

best_50_indicators.name: Patent applications, residents
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Patent applications are worldwide patent applications filed through the Patent Cooperation Treaty procedure or with a national patent office for exclusive rights for an invention--a product or process
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: patent applications, residents?

best_50_indicators.name: Research and development expenditure (% of GDP)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Gross domestic expenditures on research and development (R&D), expressed as a percent of GDP. They include both capital and current expenditures in the four main sectors: Business enterprise, Governme
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: research and development expenditure?

best_50_indicators.name: Rail lines (total route-km)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: The total length of rail line in the country operated for passenger transport, goods transport, or both.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: rail lines?

best_50_indicators.name: Labor force participation rate, female (% of female population ages 15+) (modeled ILO estimate)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: The labor force participation rate is the labor force as a percent of the population ages 15 and older. The labor force is the sum of all persons of working age who are employed and those who are unem
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: labor force participation rate, female?

best_50_indicators.name: Labor force participation rate, male (% of male population ages 15+) (modeled ILO estimate)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Labor force participation rate is the proportion of the population ages 15 and older that is economically active: all people who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specifie
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: labor force participation rate, male?

best_50_indicators.name: Fixed broadband subscriptions (per 100 people)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Fixed broadband subscriptions refers to fixed subscriptions to high-speed access to the public Internet (a TCP/IP connection), at downstream speeds equal to, or greater than, 256 kbit/s. This includes
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: fixed broadband subscriptions?

best_50_indicators.name: Mobile cellular subscriptions (per 100 people)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: Mobile cellular telephone subscriptions are subscriptions to a public mobile telephone service that provide access to the PSTN using cellular technology. The indicator includes (and is split into) the
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country has the most mobile phones per person?

best_50_indicators.name: Secure Internet servers (per 1 million people)
best_50_indicators.sourceNote: The number of distinct, publicly-trusted TLS/SSL certificates found in the Netcraft Secure Server Survey (by hosting country), per 1 million people.
best_50_indicators.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: secure internet servers?

all_game_worthy.name: Rail lines (total route-km)
all_game_worthy.sourceNote: The total length of rail line in the country operated for passenger transport, goods transport, or both.

all_game_worthy.name: Secure Internet servers (per 1 million people)
all_game_worthy.sourceNote: The number of distinct, publicly-trusted TLS/SSL certificates found in the Netcraft Secure Server Survey (by hosting country), per 1 million people.

all_game_worthy.suggested_challenge: Which country ranks highest in: international tourism, receipts?
